page.title: 03 Public Transport.
page.content: Nearly everybody in the village has a car and people give each other lifts. The only public services are by bus.The regular services are by Hants and Dorset and are part of the route between Weymouth and Bournemouth.There is one bus each day from Winterborne Kingston to Poole and one bus in the return direction each day. Access to a bus route linking Salisbury,Blandford, Dorchester and Weymouth can be gained by a journey of about two miles in a number of directions to the main roads over which these routes run. This service is infrequent. There is also a market bus which runs from the village to Blandford every Thursday morning. The nearest railway station is at Wareham about six miles away where trains on the Waterloo-Weymouth line stop. There is a coach to London every day from Bere Regis.
